posts.edge_media_to_caption: My dear friend @paris.reid painted this for my 29th birthday today ‚ù§Ô∏è thank you for all the birthday wishes! I‚Äôve had such a wonderful time already. xoxo

üíñ Happy Mother‚Äôs Day weekend üíû If you're in London, last day of Transparent Love exhibition at #BFIFlare is tomorrow. Love these photographs. #TransDayOfVisibility #MothersDay
üì∏ @amandas_photo

üÜò With the awareness generated by #metoo, there is an increased demand for support services as more people are emboldened to name what happened to them.‚ù£Ô∏èRape Crisis Centres‚ù£Ô∏èoffer much-needed support to people who have been assaulted across England and Wales (@rapecrisisew), but demand way outstrips supply.‚ùóÔ∏èThis time last year, there were 6,355 survivors on Rape Crisis waiting lists and these can be as long as 14 months.‚ÄºÔ∏è This means that if a survivor calls to look for support they may be turned away...
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
‚åõÔ∏èüí∑ Successive UK governments have failed to fund life-saving services. There are just 44 Rape Crisis Centres in England and Wales. üéØ But the Istanbul Convention (which our Government will soon ratify) sets out a minimum provision of support for victims of rape which would require that there be 150 Rape Crisis Centres in England and Wales. üö® It‚Äôs simply unacceptable that a country like mine falls so far short of the minimum standards set across Europe.
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
üìã‚ù§Ô∏è‚úçüèª So on #IWD2019, I encourage you to sign Fern‚Äôs petition üëÜüèªLINK IN BIOüëÜüèªand demand that Theresa May guarantees sustained üí∞ funding for rape crisis support services, üíå so the survivors of sexual violence can access the support they need. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
üîóüìã‚úçüèª tinyurl.com/FernsPetition
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
üí™üèªüë©üèº These are the words of 25-year-old Fern Champion, who was raped in 2016 and has launched a petition üíå asking the Prime Minister to ensure that specialist rape counselling support is always available for everyone who seeks it:
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
ü§≤üèª üíî ‚ÄúBy not adequately funding support services this Government is telling survivors that their recovery does not matter and by extension that they do not matter. When you have been raped, the vital, life-saving counselling should just be there when you need it.‚Äù üôåüèª‚ù§Ô∏èüëèüèª
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
‚òéÔ∏è RAPE CRISIS NATIONAL HELPLINE: 0808 802 9999 (rapecrisis.org.uk)

Whether you‚Äôre ü•Åmarching, üíÉüèªdancing, üåπrising, ‚úäüèªresisting, üí•protesting, üö´striking, ‚ù§Ô∏èuniting or üéàcelebrating, wishing you all a wonderful #internationalwomensday! ü•∞ #IWD2019 #joyfulwarriors

posts.edge_media_to_caption:
üõç It's a minefield out there in the fashion world !! Fair trade, organic, sustainable, ethical, vegan, carbon neutral, artisanal, fast fashion, slow fashion. What does it all mean?! ü§∑üèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Does it matter? What matters most? How do I choose? What is green washing? Which information or recommendations do I trust? ü•≥ I was SO happy (and relieved!) to find the @goodonyou_app team because their app made the information easy and accessible for me.
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
They take into account information from over 50 certification schemes, standard systems and NGO rating projects. Then they break down and rate brands based on their impact on üßµ labour, üå≥ the environment and üêë animals, rating them either 'Great', 'Good', 'It's a Start', 'Not Good Enough' and 'We Avoid'. They also suggest ethical alternatives to anything you might be looking for.
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
Their articles are also brilliant, up to date and on the button. You can also favourite any brands you want to remember. ü§≥üèºüë©üèº‚Äçüíª Check them out üòé

Really excited about our üåº March & April üìñ pick üåº Fierce Femmes and Notorious Liars: A Dangerous Trans Girl‚Äôs Confabulous Memoir by #kaichengthom. ü¶ã LINK to my @oursharedshelf letter IN BIO ü¶ã

üåª‚ú®‚úåüèª So honoured to be working alongside Nobel Peace Laureates @nadia_murad_taha, @drdenismukwege @ouidedbouchamaoui, and other üß† thought leaders, üåà creatives and üå±üí™üèª campaigners such as @AranyaJohar Assia Benziane @missaissa as part of the Gender Equality Council advising the G7 this year during the French Presidency. üíê It's a source of sadness to us all that Nasrin Sotoudeh can only participate in absentia. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
ü§≤üèªüíû Together we‚Äôll be continuing the work of the first Council convened last year in Canada and will be pushing G7 states and others to do more to make gender equality a reality at home and abroad. ‚è∞ At a time when many might feel a loss of confidence in politicians and the state, it's easy to forget how vital üó≥ national governments andüë©üèº‚Äç‚öñÔ∏è legislation are in the ‚öôÔ∏è wheel of factors that create meaningful and lasting change.‚ôüüì∞ ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
‚ù§Ô∏èüö® Disengaging is quite simply not an option when in many parts of the world, we're seeing roll-backs üï∞üîô on women and girls' rights and üö´üí∞ cutbacks and corrosions to the basic state services that guarantee these rights. ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
üôãüèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è As a Council, we‚Äôll be recommending ways that states can improve their laws üîéüìú‚úçüèª to strengthen women‚Äôs rights and will be encouraging them to make new commitments to ensure accountability and access to justice. üó£‚öñÔ∏è ‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
üèÉüèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüí® The clock is ticking though and we have a lot of work to do before the G7 meets in the summer, ‚è≥‚òÄÔ∏è but I'm excited to work alongside so many experts I admire, and to learn from my Council colleagues and the civil society groups that come together as W7. ‚úäüèªüíõ
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
As one of the youngest members of the group, üçÉüå∏ I hope to bring the perspective of different generations to the table, as well as ensuring that the voices of the many activists, campaigners, women's organisations and movements that I've spent the past years working with andüëÇüèªüíì listening to, reverberate through the Council's work. üé∂üåº
‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä‚†Ä
@g7 #g7biarritz
